How Do Fan Coils Work?

http://www.allweathercontractors.com/news/how-do-fan-coils-work/

Air conditioners and heat pumps control the temperature in your Jacksonville home or office, but fan coils are often overlooked even though they are essential parts of AC units and heating systems that allow residents to live and work comfortably. The coils are often used instead of furnaces and evaporator coils to convert refrigerant from a gas to a liquid (or the other way around.) Subsequently, the fan blows air over the coils, which creates a heating or cooling effect on the surrounding area.

Each type of fan coil corresponds to a specific type of refrigerant. Puron refrigerant has become the most popular kind of refrigerant because it has been approved by the United States Environmental Protection Agency as environmentally friendly. Unlike many refrigerants, Puron will not harm the ozone layer. R—22 is another common type of refrigerant, but it is not as environmentally sound as Puron. Additionally, there are different speed options for the fan part of the fan coil..

What Are Duct Free Systems?

http://www.allweathercontractors.com/news/what-are-duct-free-systems/

They are a great solution for homes or businesses that do not already have ductwork installed within the home to support a central air conditioning system, since they do not require the use of existing ductwork or the installation of new ductwork to solve cooling distribution needs. Carrier ductless air conditioners are a very efficient cooling option, and are rated as high as 23 SEER.

These creative systems combine an outdoor condensing unit and an indoor fan coil for a convenient and clutter-free alternative to traditional heating and cooling units. The indoor and outdoor components are connected by simple wires and tubing and take up minimal space without blocking windows. Unlike conventional systems that operate in homes with ductwork, these systems offer a relief from the distracting sound by being virtually noise-free.
